description: From Medieval Latin stigmatizo (“to brand”), from Ancient Greek στιγματίζω (stigmatízō, “to mark”), from στίγμα (stígma).

verbs.description: stigmatize (third-person singular simple present stigmatizes, present participle stigmatizing, simple past and past participle stigmatized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To characterize as disgraceful or ignominious; to mark with a stigma or stigmata.
